thread.title: Man City boss Pep Guardiola won't write off Barcelona's Champions League hopes
thread.title_full: Man City boss Pep Guardiola won't write off Barcelona's Champions League hopes

author: Simon Bajkowski
title: Man City boss Pep Guardiola won't write off Barcelona's Champions League hopes
text:
Sport Man City boss Pep Guardiola won't write off Barcelona's Champions League hopes The Manchester City manager still thinks his former team are in with a shout of the Champions League quarters Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Manchester City v Huddersfield Preview Share this video Get Manchester City FC     
Pep Guardiola was in no mood to join in the criticism of Luis Enrique's Barcelona. 
The La Liga side were thumped 4-0 by Paris Saint-Germain in the first leg of their Champions League last-16 clash, leading to an inquest into what is wrong at the club. 
But the Manchester City manager, who has had success at the Nou Camp as a player and coach, is not prepared to write off the team just yet. 
"Barcelona are still the best team in the world," he said. 
"It’s always a surprise because they are so, so good, but in football anything can happen. 
"There’s a lot of competition, the opposition are so strong. 
Find out how to follow Huddersfield vs Manchester City live . 
"You can win heavily or you can lose heavily, that can happen, it’s happened to me, but there are 90 minutes to go and anything can happen." Read More Pep Guardiola offers Gabriel Jesus update after Man City striker undergoes surgery 
Asked if Barcelona can reverse their 4-0 deficit in the return leg, the coach said: "If there’s a team who can do it it’s Barca. 
"It’s normal that there are so many things said because they are a team that has dominated world football for 10 years and when you have dominated world football it’s normal that the people expect you to keep up that level, but my advice - knowing Luis Enrique and the players a little - is not to talk too much because they will be back and prove you wrong. 
"They’ve done it over the years, dominating football for 10 years, and they continue to be the best team in the world." Read More
